body_html:
Finally I could manage to compile Tensorflow 1.0. The problem was solved after applying the suggestion in #3261 (comment)

After setting the linker flag in the /tools/cpp/CROSSTOOL in bazel and the /thirdparty/sycl/crosstool/CROSSTOOL.tpl in the tensorflow directory, the error was no longer showing up.
body_text:
Finally I could manage to compile Tensorflow 1.0. The problem was solved after applying the suggestion in #3261 (comment)
After setting the linker flag in the /tools/cpp/CROSSTOOL in bazel and the /thirdparty/sycl/crosstool/CROSSTOOL.tpl  in the tensorflow directory, the error was no longer showing up.
body:
Finally I could manage to compile Tensorflow 1.0. The problem was solved after applying the suggestion in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/3261#issuecomment-234147379

After setting the linker flag in the /tools/cpp/CROSSTOOL in bazel and the /thirdparty/sycl/crosstool/CROSSTOOL.tpl  in the tensorflow directory, the error was no longer showing up.
